authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Ulster Hospital Ward 5C
body: The guys on Ward 5C have been exemplary in everything they've done for me. I was admitted due to my own stupidity, yet I was made to feel welcome, and looked after to an extremely high standard. I can't remember every staff members' name, but they all deserve high praise indeed.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sallball15
title: Exceptional end of life care for my father
body:
My father was very ill in January this year and received exceptional care in ward 41, Altnagelvin. He spent his last days here, and the care and compassion displayed by all the staff was second to none.  
He was extremely well looked after and nothing was a bother to the staff, they went over and above to make sure he was comfortable at all times. As a family, they supported us throughout the tough few weeks we had.  
Dr Keiron, incredible at his job and so compassionate. The nurses, Colleen, Megan, Sally and Rachel were amazing. These are a few of the wonderful people who are truly amazing at what they do.  
We would like thank all the staff for everything they did for our daddy, and us during this terrible time. They are all exceptional.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Katymc
title: I want to thank you all
body:
My son dislocated his shoulder saving a goal in a football match last night.  
I met him at Ealing A&E. He was in a massive amount of pain, the department was super busy, but the care and attention he got from the reception, X-ray department, doctors, nurses, porters was amazing.  
I want to thank every one of you all for such amazing care, 🙏🙏🙏

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: jomelia1975
title: Poor service
body:
Following on from COVID diagnosis in March 2022 I contacted my GP practice as was experiencing difficulty breathing as a result of my asthma/ COVID/respiratory issues. I wanted to speak to a Dr. As per surgery guidelines day 1, I called at 8am. After waiting 45 mins receptionist answered the call and with all my determination I tried to speak my name.  
Receptionist started impatiently stating are you going to speak up I can't hear you, they continued to speak over me and due to this couldn't hear me and what I was attempting to say, leaving me with no option but having to try repeat myself with great difficulty. Due to covid/impaired breathing I was trying so hard to talk and asked that they please be patient with me as I was trying so much to breath/talk.  
I desperately tried to speak and was told no appointments left to call back the following day. Day 2 at 8am the following day I called and again waited in a que for 40 mins was getting same will you speak up I can't hear you by this time my breathing had significantly deteriorated and I tried my hardest to talk and was told a g.p would call me back same day. I waited until 5pm no call returned. I called surgery advising I was awaiting a call back only for a receptionist to say you didn't phone here at 8am this morning as no call logged... No listening/empathy understanding and when I insisted I did call they went away looked into this and said to me only 1 Dr on today & short staffed & you been missed, so call back tomorrow morning at 8am.  
Feeling worse day 3 I called at 8.00am 43rd on que after 50 minutes later receptionist answered and immediately hunt up saying I can't hear you and hung up. I called back immediately again waited in que only for call to be answered and yet again told no appointments through no fault of my own.  
Day 4 phoned at 8am got appointment with a nurse that lead to me having to attend hospital immediately due to severity of my symptoms. The hospital say on arrival don't let your symptoms get as bad as this next time. Despite trying all week at g.p for appointment. All receptionist that I spoke to that week we're totally disinterested, lack of telephone skills or empathy throughout all interactions.  
Reception staff on dealing with them are rude, impatient, poor customer service, extremely lack communication skills both listening and verbal.From my experience I found them unprofessional and appear to lack any training on all matters that involve working with public. They seem to have little if any regard that they are first point of contact for people who are POORLY. Given that COVID has been a global pandemic that effects people's breathing why are receptionist staff hanging up on phone call after 2 seconds after waiting on hold for 50 minutes desperate to get an appointment. Reception staff would appear to have little training/knowledge/understanding on COVID/effects of COVID/respiratory issues and how to communicate effectively on a telephone which is bizarre considering reception staff are first point of contact for a g.p practice that has a duty of care to its poorly patients. This impatience and lack of tolerance demonstrates a lack of willingness to help people who are calling the surgery because they are POORLY. Yes COVID has impacted services however from my experience of this surgery over 13 yrs has been poor. When people are being advised not to attend over run and over-worked hospitals and encouraged to attend g.p to stay away from hospitals where on earth is people supposed to get g.p advice from when can't get to speak to a g.p or bypass a unhelpful receptionist. Yes I understand that I am not the only patient that is unwell and yes it is also a big practice however If I had to treat individuals in this manner in my job I would get dismissed as this would not be tolerated so don't see why it's been allowed for years in this surgery.  
[Unsure about 'Staff attitude']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Corsairs
title: District nurses are prompt and helpful
body:
District nurses call twice a day to administer chemotherapy.  
They are very good and attend twice a day to give an injection. They are usually very prompt and helpful.

author: andromedajb95
title: Exceptional staff
body:
I have been attending the Medical Day Care unit in the Ulster Hospital over the past number of years and I just wanted to comment on the top class care and service i receive on every occasion.  
On every occasion I have attended, all of the Staff have been absolutely fantastic, always very professional, very helpful and friendly. It is very clear to see the pride and dedication they have in doing their jobs to ensure us the patients are treated in the best way possible.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lynxhb58
title: Dealing with my phobia of bees and wasps
body:
I would jump, shout and run if a bee or wasp came near me. Slowly over time I gave up more activities, and avoided situations until the issue was affecting my happiness, and time with family or friends.  
Going through therapy has allowed me to understand why my situation was getting worse, and begin a course of action to steadily take back the ground that I'd lost. Being supported by one to one online sessions, setting plans and actions that allowed me to take small steps to gain confidence has been brilliant.  
I've finished therapy now and have a plan to take forward. I may have set backs at times, but knowing why I got so bad, means I will never fall as far again.  
I'll never be best friends with wasps, but the cold dread and panic is no longer controlling me. I can now look forward to outdoor social events as I used to.

author: Hip patient
title: The care I received was outstanding
body: I have just been discharged from ward 9D in QEUH having had emergency bowel surgery. I have to comment on the care I received there as it was outstanding.  Senior Charge Nurse Myles should be very proud of her amazing team. I remember some names but not them all, please don't be offend if your not there. I’m getting old and forgetful. Staff Nurses like Jodie, Johnathon, Cameron, Chelsea, Margaret and Chevonne were caring, compassionate and professional. Ensuring the care I received excelled. Even the students were working at an advanced level, Lucy and the young man involved my care were fantastic. I also cant fail to mention the absolutely amazing team of clinical support workers, Scott and the girls on night shift could not have done more. Last but not least my amazing consultant surgeons Mr ALani and Mr Shapter ensured all decision making was shared and I also new I was in kind, capable and proficient hands. The NHS is lucky to have you all. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

title: Poor front of house service/telephone system
body:
Im my 84yr old mothers main carer, I tried contacting her Doctor at Green Gate Lane Medical Centre Birstall today (06.06.2022) from 9am, Telephone permanently engaged, its now 12.45pm, phone is still engaged. This happens often and I end up having to drive to the surgery to arrange a call back from my mothers doctor, this is just not good enough. 

My mother was discharged from the hospital two weeks ago after a bad fall causing a bad trauma to her head and broken ribs pressing on her lungs, she was put on morphine patches for the pain and was told to liaise with her doctor.

This is just not good enough.

title: DIY Physiotherapy
body: Google services!!! I was waiting to see physio for months. My appointments were cancelled on few occasions. Finally had opportunity to talk to medically trained staff and what a surprise! Physiotherapist talked to me from 3 m distance though mask, keep looking up on internet my condition, never examine me and concluded that I should go private because RUH only running trial sessions and advise to go private after all if patient feel the treatment was working. Its shocking realisation what we are paying for!!!

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

author: EsMum
title: Poor care following a c section
body:
I went in to be induced in July. Very long story short, I had a brilliant experience in the labour ward, those girls were calm, attentive, on the ball, informative and listened. The after care in the maternity ward was a disgrace.  
I had a c sections, and I am a nurse, so I was aware of the after care that was expected.  
I was met by a midwife who introduced themselves, not by telling me their name but by saying, I haven't had my break yet. I had just been wheeled back from recovery after an emergency section. I saw this staff member once after that.  
To cut out all the in between stuff about poor manners, lack of communication and sheer disregard for a woman who was struggling post op the midwives had not  
-done my post op observations  
-checked for pp bleeding or checked my wound  
-checked the baby on day two or day 3  
- could not insert my cannula and I had to insert it myself WHILST BREASTFEEDING MY BABY.  
-did not communicate with me or tell me that I was supposed to buzz to let them help me put the baby back into the cot or lift it out, leading to me struggling and in a lot of pain. sure why didnt you buzz? -probably because I had such a frosty reception I was too scared to.  
I had no idea I was allowed as I had asked for help to latch on and they said no one would be available to help for several hours and to give a bottle instead. Try telling that to a baby thats a few hours old.  
I discharged myself against medical advice as I was distraught. as I work in the health service I would never ever bash a team of people unless it was essential but this was the worst experience of my life and has left me emotionally shaken since.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Breast Screening: Amazing department
body: I was nervous after being called to return after a mammogram.  I was dealt with quickly, professionally with great care.  I had an ultrasound and then local anaesthetic to prepare for the draining of a cyst.  I was very impressed and felt reassured.  Thank you all so much. Jan

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Gone down hill
body: I have been with The Limes for 67 years since I was born, this is the worst state that I have ever seen this surgery in... waiting on phones 60 - 90 Minutes.. being told sorry you will have to call back tomorrow morning at 8am and wait for when all the appointments have gone yet again. They forget to include repeat Medication on repeat prescriptions 3 times this has happened to me in the last 6 months and I have had to phone to let them know .... the Surgery is a Joke

title: Excellent, friendly service
body: I simply don’t recognise the Green Man Practice from the preceding reviews. My experience over many years of the practice has been extremely positive. The reception staff are friendly and helpful, the Doctors are concerned and constructive and the practice nurse is a pleasure to deal with. I fully recommend the Green Man practice.

title: Fantastic doctor
body:
My mum was seen by a doctor on the 8/6/22. She had a telephone consult but was not able to assess her so asked her to come to the surgery.
He fully examined my mum and was so lovely,patient and caring and he listened to my mum and remembered her from a previous visit, such a good doctor. The doctor arranged for her to go to ward 5 for assessment.
Thank goodness for this she now has a diagnosis and is being treated for a hole in her bowel. Thank you so much for this amazing service.
A very grateful patients family 
Thank you again.

title: Methods of ordering  repeat prescriptions is a…
body: I think you know iordering prescriptions is a mess and you doing your best but this is my experience today. I use the NHS App. I reset my password. I wade down the navigation and it says i have no repeat prescriptions. I use MyGP I get in using the same password, but this time it sends a code to my phone I click on several useless stages and get to my repeat prescription to find that it says rejected againsted 3 of the 4 medications. So next I go to the Vine Medical Centre Website navigate to repeat prescriptions where I have a choice of 4 options I choose the one I think I have used before. Yes its the right one because last month I chose the option to send an image of my paper prescription only to get an email from the surgery the next day to say that they cant use input from that and could I type in the list of medications. So there are methods which know what I want but dont work and the method that does works that makes me type them in. I put in quantity of 28  for 3 of them and 30 for the other. It used to let me say max because I have a stable prescrition and so 3 months would make more sense. I would save me time and 2 visits to the pharmacy, it would save the surgery 2 lots of processing and the cost of doing that, but of course the pharmacy makes more money by having 3 sales rather than 1 and I do not know why the surgery is in cahoots with this rip off.  There was a time when you could order in the morning and pick up the paper prescription that afternnoon - now because of a huge increase in housing and the government not training enough staff it can take up to 7 working days. When I get into the Medi-pharmacy I am expecting that I will then have to go through the "game" of "We cant find any record of that". If I didnt suffer from anxiety from many sources at age 76 then this alone would induce the condition. It is a mess. Combined with an attitude of we mustprotect our doctors from patient seeing them in person I dispare. When I get into the Vine itself the reception desk is variable from absolutely wonderful to down right obstructive. The doctors and clinical staff are universally excellent.

title: Kind and reassuring
body: sadly I cannot name the midwife in this review but I had the pleasure of being seen by a lovely lady in he delivery suite this morning after concerns that at 22 weeks pregnant my baby hadn’t moved for over a day. I was so totally reassured by the Midwife, she was calm and confident with a warm nature. My partner is a bit of a joker and she took him with a pinch of salt and even entertained him a little. She went above and beyond to help me, gathering some other results I had been waiting on for weeks in just a few minutes (I had been waiting for these results for 10 weeks). She was just so lovely and my partner and I left feeling so happy and content with the treatment we received. I really hope she’s available on the day of my birth. Great service, I hope her professionalism and kindness is acknowledged.

title: Friendly service throughout
body:
From filling in an online form about my sons cough, I was soon contacted and an appointment was made for him. The receptionist was very friendly. 
Couldn't fault the doctor. She was very calm and patient with my 2 year old and put my mind at ease.
Would definitely recommend the surgery.

title: A vast improvement on my previous practice
body: I decided to leave my previous practice due to multiple failings in my care; I made the right choice.  After being chronically ill for over 3 years, I saw a GP this week at Pelaw who was incredibly thorough in trying to find the answers I have desperately needed for so long.  And within two days, the test results have revealed those answers, and on the same day the results became available, I got the meds I needed.  This is the NHS at its best - and believe me, after three years of suffering, I know what Pelaw Medical Practice have done for me this week is truly exceptional.

author: nuthatchtb97
title: Getting tested for STIs
body:
Getting through on phone was difficult  
But once I was talking to someone, they were very helpful and sensitive .  
Jake was particularly great and very reassuring  
Thank you!

title: Fort-House is in a rapid decline of quality…
body:
I have witnessed over the past 2 years how Fort-House quality has gone down, seeing patients being pushed away more and more. There are just more bureaucratic processes in place every time I visit. Today, I phoned and spoke to someone regarding my complete blood tests result. This is a complex set of numbers, such as cholesterol levels etc. The result that was given to me was: "all normal, no action required". Of course, I'm interested in my exact cholesterol levels and various other results (thyroid & kidney function etc  etc etc). 

Seeing that the person on the lines simply tried to get me to hang up, I requested my results so that I can interpret it myself. Even such simple request was not approved and I was pointed to their website to formally request this via some cumbersome process. Further more ... I was told that such request can't be made today, since they are already over capacity to send out reports.

How competent is a surgery, when they can't even click "email to patient" while discussing your records with you over the phone? My wife requested similar results a short while back, whilst speaking to the doctor and he responded immediately to her request with an automated email sent out.

It really is shocking how you either (1) can't speak to a human at the surgery anymore or (2) ALWAYS get referred back to their website for any requests that you have. EVERYTHING has to go through tedious online form submissions to make even the most basic request.

Also, my son (7yrs old) had tonsillitis a short while back. I called on a Thursday to ask to be seen and the earliest they had availability to see him, was the following week Tuesday!!! How is that possible!???? 

Yet! ... They have recently decided to take even more patients on, whilst they already can't cope with their regular patients. 

This is utterly appalling service from Fort House and their excuse of COVID being the reason is long not acceptable anymore.

title: Blood test
body: Blood test- general. Great speedy treatment. No problem and friendly nurse. I wouldn’t hesitate on coming again.

title: Great care
body: I had a heart attack my 3rd in November, I was scared.  I had to stay in hospital for 7 days and have a stent put in one of my arteries.  I had the most wonderful care.  On a couple of wards first then eventually in the heart centre.  The staff in all these area was very caring and professional.  I feel lucky to have been treated here.  Thank you so much

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: RUBISH
body:
Phoned for appointment at 18.00 hrs this evening told i was number 3 in line at 17.45 was number 1   at approx 19. 52 they link  cut off and when I tried to phone back a recording said that the service  was now closed for this evening, did not even tell me what time they opened again in the morning    I find this completely unacceptable  I was phoning on my landline so who knows how much this will cost  I am 75 years old and every penny counts  Why give these numbers
out to the public if the service does not work                                 
The NHS is a brilliant service the best in the world  BUT your admin
is so so poor that it lets the whole system down  which is so sad
because we as blessed with such care we get from all medical staff

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Great Care
body: I was nervous it would be a male doing my endoscope.  It was two wonderful female practitioners, they prepared me mentally and physically with amazing care and professionalism.  I was very worried about having the procedure but it was quick and nearly pain free nothing that caused concern.  I would not be so nervous if I had to have this procedure again.  Thank you so much

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant GP Surgery
body: Appointments always available, helpful staff who are always very welcoming. Experienced doctors, nurses and paramedic who spend time to explain things simply and provide you with a plan of treatment. Fast service and overall a fantastic GP practice!

title: Awful
body:
I was encouraged to use this app to work through the different modules which I started.  I had a couple of phone appointments with my supporter and he could see the questionnaire that I had completed.  I was unable to make a scheduled phone apt so I sent a msg using the app - the message has not been responded to, nor subsequent ones. I shared a couple of journal entries because I was feeling extremely low but I heard nothing.  This left me feeling far worse than before I started to engage with this service.
When I log in, in the vague hope that someone might have bothered to have a look at my messages all I get is a sentence saying that my supporter is due to leave a review on 28th February - well we are now in June and if it hadn’t affected me as much as it has it would be funny.  I can honestly say that this service has done nothing but make my mental health worse and feeling completely abandoned.  With the way the world has been in the past two years it is genuinely concerning that people who are struggling are being advised to use this sub par service.  I’m sure it has potential, maybe my “supporter” just wasn’t bothered.  All I can say is when you are struggling with anxiety, depression etc, to feel unheard or ignored is devastating.

title: Fantastic experience
body:
Your review:   I attended today for major dental surgery. Throughout the entire process, the staff were impeccable. I was made to feel at ease, the atmosphere was relaxed, friendly and professional.

From start to finish I was kept abreast of each step of the way. I was asked numerous times about who I was, which clearly limits any mistakes. My vital signs were constantly monitored prior to my surgery. The Dentist and Anaesthetist explained in full what I was going to have. They answered my queries with ease and with total dignity.

The Nurses who looked after me; pre & post surgery were phenomenal. They were witty, friendly, kind natured and thoroughly professional.

I was initially scared about my surgery as I have a real fear of all things medical. Within seconds, my anxiety was relinquished as I was met by friendly people at reception. I was led to the ward and from the very start I was welcomed, put at ease and I felt relaxed.

The Porter who led me to surgery was equally friendly and chatty.

Throughout the day I was given expert advice on how to take care of myself; post surgery.

In short; every member of staff I encountered today were absolutely amazing.

I want to thank and congratulate each and every one of you.

Even at the start of the day when we arrived at the Hospital; we kind of got ourselves lost. The staff on the various other departments were super friendly and pointed us in the right direction.

To sum up, no, none of us likes attending Hospitals, but I can assure you this, if today’s experience is anything to go by, fear not !!

Thank you Trafford General ( or Park Hospital) as it was when I was growing up 😊

You have all inspired me to write this much worthy review.

title: What a great team
body: Had to have a biopsy at the urology department, all the team there were fantastic to me and all the other patients there, caring and kind, thank you

title: Quick and caring
body: I was seen on tie for my appointment. The staff were all good, the nurse was caring and efficient and gave me good supportive advice, thank you all.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: pharmacy
body:
I arrived at the department at 1.55 for a 2.0 pm appointment. Eventually  was sent to the Boots Pharmacy at 2.35. After handing in the prescription I was told the waiting time would be about 35 minutes.There were around 30 people waiting for prescriptions to be dispensed, this is not counting the numerous people crossing the space to pay for purchases
and  deliveries being made . I waited for 1 hour 25 minutes before the medication was brought out and this after reminding the pharmacist of how long I had been waiting.  The medication was not the ones prescribed and I was given a substitute. This pharmacy is overworked and I did not feel it was a safe place due to the over crowding, most people had to stand as there is inadequate seating.
Why can't prescriptions be e mailed or a text sent to a pharmacy of ones choice to avoid such an overcrowded environment. This service is totally inadequate due to the volume of people.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice.
body:
Today I received a text message requesting me to complete a survey about the service I received from my recent visit to the Surgery.
I was unable to access the survey, so would like to comment here.  I visited the surgery for a routine blood test, as usual all was done in a most professional manner, the set up at the surgery is really good and I felt safe, the person that took my blood was kind, pleasant and most reassuring.  I feel that we in Sibsey and surrounding areas are lucky to have such an excellent practice.
